data.title: Very decent sushi and great happy hour pricinh
data.text: When we lived in Cardiff many moons ago this had a different name and had been a sushi restaurant for many years.   New name but service good and great happy hour pricinh on their menu.  If you are going for dinner though DO NOT get there earlier than 5:30 as you'll be waiting outside.  Not a problem unless like me you're wearing t shirt and shorts with temperature going from comfortable to BRRRR!  other than t h at no problems.

data.title: OK sushi, great happy hour until 7:30pm
data.text: Stopped here after the sushi place we previously frequented closed.   Took a while to get a table on Friday evening (around 6:45pm), but we were pleasantly surprised by the happy hour prices!  Sushi was OK, definitely not great.  The hand rolls were low on fish and high on rice.  Nigiri sushi was also about average.  I had an order of uni, quality was great, serving size was a bit smallish for the price (not a happy hour item).   Overall, if you hit this place for happy hour, you will probably be happy.  If you come another time, you will probably feel like you paid too much for mediocre sushi and thin service....

data.title: Now called Sushido
data.text: This restaurant is now called Sushido.  I don't know if it's the same restaurant as Sakura under a new name or new management or something totally unrelated.  Whatever.  Sushi was great.  Good price, good specials.  I'm not a sushi snob, I do enjoy a California roll, so I don't know what someone with a better sushi palette would say, but I thought everything was yummy.  No bad fish smell, which is always a sign that a restaurant uses fresh ingredients and stores things correctly.  Attentive, unobtrusive service.  Try the Vegas roll!  Surprisingly large number of families with children 10 and older.  I guess California kids like sushi!

data.title: My favorite Sushi is North County
data.text: This restaurant is right on the 101 and serves great sushi.  My husband and I go at least once every week or two for Happy Hour sushi.  Tuesday-Friday (I think) from 5-6pm is Happy Hour and at least a dozen rolls are 1/2 price.  The Rainbow Roll is AMAZING as is the Crunchy Shrimp Roll.  They serve many other rolls as well but those are the two we get pretty much every time.  The restaurant is small so if you are going for Happy Hour you need to get there by 5:15 or so.  There isn't a ton of ambiance but the food more than makes up for it.
